thread.title: Trump: The Wall Will Go Up But The Price Will Go Down
thread.title_full: Trump: The Wall Will Go Up But The Price Will Go Down

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump: The Wall Will Go Up But The Price Will Go Down
text:
Trump: The Wall Will Go Up But The Price Will Go Down "... I have not gotten involved ..." by Jack Davis February 11, 2017 at 10:05am 
It is going to be big and beautiful. 
And at a very nice price. 
President Donald Trump tweeted Saturday that Americans should take with a grain of salt the high price tags being bandied about for the construction of a barrier along Americas Southern Border. Advertisement - story continues below 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 11, 2017 …design or negotiations yet. When I do, just like with the F-35 FighterJet or the Air Force One Program, price will come WAY DOWN! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 11, 2017 
Trump has never given a precise budget estimate for the costs of constructing the wall, but he tossed around an estimate of $10 billion while he was still a candidate. Advertisement - story continues below 
Other estimates run higher. CNN on Saturday noted some guesses run as high as $25 billion. Reuters , citing a department of Homeland Security document, pegged the cost at $21.6 billion and estimated it would take three years to build. 
The report said construction would be done in phases, with the first phase covering 26 miles near San Diego, El Paso, Texas, and in the Rio Grande Valley of Texas. 
Trump told police chiefs Wednesday that plans for his signature project are moving forward. 
“The wall is getting designed right now. We will have a wall. It will be a great wall and it will do a lot of — will be a big help,” Trump said during a speech before the Major Cities Chiefs Police Association. Advertisement - story continues below
